thread.title: Cardinals fall in LHC, regular-season finale
thread.title_full: Cardinals fall in LHC, regular-season finale

title: Cardinals fall in LHC, regular-season finale
text:
Cardinals fall in LHC, regular-season finale Published: Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 11:09 a.m. CDT • Updated: Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 11:37 a.m. CDT Caption (Jocelyn Sheets/Daily News) Newton High junior Megan Pressgrove (11) sets the ball as teammates get into postion to attack the net during a recent home match. The Cardinals were on the road Tuesday, dropping a Little Hawkeye Conference decision to host Norwalk, which is ranked No. 11 in Class 4A. By Jocelyn Sheets Newton Daily News 
NORWALK — On the road against the No. 11 team in Class 4A to wind up the regular season, Newton High’s Cardinals battled on the volleyball court. Norwalk’s Warriors posted a 25-21, 25-16, 25-14 win over the visiting Cardinals in Little Hawkeye Conference action. 
“The girls worked hard tonight and finished out the regular season,” Newton head coach Laura Sherratt said. “We will be taking the positives from tonight and building on those to take into the postseason. Monday brings on tournament time and anything can happen.” 
Newton doubled its match wins from a year ago. The Cardinals finish the regular season 16-19 overall after going 7-29 with only one senior on the team in 2014. Newton was 0-6 in LHC play a year ago and the Cardinals were 1-5 this season. 
The Cardinals’ conference win came in a five-set match at home against Grinnell on Sept. 29. Those two teams play Monday at Newton in the first round of Class 4A Region 4 play. The match begins at 7 p.m. 
Against Norwalk, juniors Taylor Shipley, Megan Pressgrove and Kaytlin Ahn delivered six kills apiece at the net for the Cardinals. 
Senior Emily Fitzgerald downed two kills while seniors Stephanie Hoebelheinrich and Allison Ergenbright each had one kill. 
Pressgrove was credited with 15 set assists, and Shipley had eight set assists. Pressgrove recorded a solo block while Ahn and junior Morgan Allen each had an assisted block. 
Newton went 43-of-46 from the service line in the match. Senior Fran Lucas served two aces, and Hoebelheinrich had one ace serve. 
Shipley and Fran Lucas each had 10 digs. Ahn made eight digs and Pressgrove had four digs. 
Sophomore Audrey Lucas had two digs. Credited with one dig each were Fitzgerald, Hoebelheinrich and junior Savannah Reicks. 
In junior varsity play, Norwalk defeated Newton, 25-13, 25-7. 
The Cardinal freshmen lost 25-10, 25-15 to Norwalk. Tegan Simmons served two aces, had one kill and two digs. Brittney McConnell had two kills and an assisted block. Arieal Lum had an assisted block and a one kill. 
“The girls played well and went out with a fight in their final game of the year. There were so many improvements by every single person on this team,” NHS freshman head coach Michaela Wood said. 
In a B-team freshman match, Newton split with Norwalk, losing the first set 25-9 and winning the second set 25-16. Mariah Wicklife had one ace serve, one kill and one dig. Serving two aces each were Skye Gregory, Anna VanDam and Hannah Edwards. Desirae Shelton served one ace. 
Contact Jocelyn Sheets at 641-792-3121 ext. 6535 or jsheets@newtondailynews.com
